steps.title: Press the “Lock” key located on the top left side of your Blackberry device.
steps.content: Press the “Lock” key located on the top left side of your Blackberry device. Your keypad will now be unlocked and ready for use. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press the button displayed below “Unlock.
steps.content: Press the button displayed below “Unlock. ” On most Motorola devices, this will be the left soft key.

steps.title: Press the * key.
steps.content: Press the * key. Your device will now be unlocked and ready for use.

steps.title: Click on the “Start” menu and select “Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on the “Start” menu and select “Control Panel. ”

steps.title: Click on the “Keyboard” tab, and remove any checkmarks displayed next to the keyboard options displayed on-screen.
steps.content: Click on the “Keyboard” tab, and remove any checkmarks displayed next to the keyboard options displayed on-screen.

steps.title: Click on “OK.
steps.content: Click on “OK. ” Your keypad or keyboard will now be unlocked and ready for use. If your keypad is still locked after following these steps, restart your computer to resolve the problem.

steps.title: Click on the Apple menu and select “System Preferences.
steps.content: Click on the Apple menu and select “System Preferences. ” [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the tab labeled “Mouse and Trackpad.
steps.content: Click on the tab labeled “Mouse and Trackpad. ”

steps.title: Select “Off” next to “Mouse Keys.
steps.content: Select “Off” next to “Mouse Keys. ” [3] X Research source

steps.title: Close System Preferences.
steps.content: Close System Preferences. Your keypad or keyboard will now be unlocked and ready for use. [4] X Research source
